snippet: New York City officials, to suit the more rigorous Common Core, plan to buy new English and math materials for kindergarten through eighth grade.
abstract: New York City Education Dept plans to buy upgraded English and math textbooks and other materials for kindergarten through eighth grade to suit more rigorous Common Core  academic standard that has been adopted by most states; costs, estimated at about $56 million, draw round of scrutiny at time of austere budgeting.
lead_paragraph: New York City officials, to suit the more rigorous Common Core, plan to buy new English and math materials for kindergarten through eighth grade.

headline.seo: New York Schools Detail Cost of Meeting New Standards
headline.main: New State Academic Standards Are Said to Require $56 Million Outlay for City’s Schools
headline.print_headline: New State Academic Standards Are Said to Require $56 Million Outlay for City’s Schools
